org.lifenoodles.jargparse

Class OptionMaker<T extends OptionMaker<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lifenoodles.jargparse.OptionMaker<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Option, Positional

    public abstract class OptionMaker<T extends OptionMaker<T>>
extends Object
    Provides a fluent interface for creating validators. These validators should be passed to a parser.
    Author:
    Donagh Hatton created on 21/07/2014.

        public T arguments(int argumentCount,
                   String... labels)
        Set the argument count for this option
        Parameters:
        argumentCount - the number of arguments this option should expect
        labels - the labels to use for usage messages for this option

      • arguments

                   int upper,
                   String... labels)
        Set the argument count for this option
        Parameters:
        lower - lower bound on argument count
        upper - upper bound on argument count
        labels - the labels to use for usage messages for this option
        Returns:
        this

      • arguments

        public T arguments(String argumentCount,
                   String... labels)
        Set the argument count for this option, recognised legal strings are: "?" (Zero or one), "*" (Zero or more) and "+" (One or more)
        Parameters:
        argumentCount - A string that is one of: "*", "+" or "?"
        labels - the labels to use for usage messages for this option. The specifics of how these labels are formatted or used will depend on the count. "?" should be given 1 label, "*" should be given 1 label, "+" should be given 1 or 2 labels
        Returns:
        this

      • description

        public T description(String description)
        Set the description for this option, this will be used when generating help text or usage text for the user
        Parameters:
        description - the description of this option
        Returns:
        this

      • matches

        public T matches(java.util.function.Predicate<String> predicate)
        Give a predicate that arguments to this option must satisfy for parsing to be successful. During parsing if this predicate fails, an exception will be thrown with the relevant information
        Parameters:
        predicate - predicate to match, default is an always true function
        Returns:
        this

      • matches

        public T matches(String... strings)
        Give a variable length list of strings. Arguments must match one of these strings to be accepted
        Parameters:
        strings - a list of valid strings
        Returns:
        this

      • matches

        public T matches(List<String> strings)
        Give a list of strings. Arguments must match one of these strings to be accepted
        Parameters:
        strings - a list of valid strings
        Returns:
